body: @gwsshs22 I left some comments.

Hi,

Could you  teach me how can I address your feedback?
This is first time to me contributing open source project, so I has
difficulty on addressing feedback on submitted pull request.

Should I make another commit and new pull request or push more commit this
pull request?

Thank you,
Geon Woo Kim.

2015년 3월 1일 일요일, Byung-Gon Chunnotifications@github.com님이 작성한 메시지:

> @gwsshs22 https://github.com/gwsshs22 I left some comments.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-reef/pull/96#issuecomment-76593398.

Please see https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/REEF/Contributing

In particular, you seem to be on step 7. TLDR: push new commits onto your github branch.
1. The code review
   REEF follows a review-then-commit (RTC) model. We perform all our code reviews on GitHub: Community members will leave comments on your pull request and suggest changes. You can have a look at prior pull requests to get an idea of what to expect. During this process, you may want to change your code. You can do that by pushing additional commits to your branch. Don't worry about squashing the commits into one at this stage. This will be done by the committer once your code is merged into REEF.

When the code review concludes, one of Committers will merge your work into the REEF codebase. Good job!

On Sun, Mar 1, 2015 at 9:41 PM, gwsshs22 notifications@github.com wrote:

> Hi,
> Could you  teach me how can I address your feedback?
> This is first time to me contributing open source project, so I has
> difficulty on addressing feedback on submitted pull request.
> Should I make another commit and new pull request or push more commit this
> pull request?
> Thank you,
> Geon Woo Kim.
> 2015년 3월 1일 일요일, Byung-Gon Chunnotifications@github.com님이 작성한 메시지:
> 
> > @gwsshs22 https://github.com/gwsshs22 I left some comments.
> > 
> > —
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> > https://github.com/apache/incubator-reef/pull/96#issuecomment-76593398.
> > 
> > ---
> > 
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> > https://github.com/apache/incubator-reef/pull/96#issuecomment-76595090
I pushed a new commit. Thank you.

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #292](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/292/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
@gwsshs22 Any chance that NetworkService's need different LinkListener's?

I have planned to make user register NetworkExceptionHandlers for each event types. Network service should set one specific LinkListener per link and it will dispatch error callback to users ExceptionHandler.

Would it be a good idea to replace "Container" with "Evaluator"? If I recall correctly, the container used for the Driver isn't counted against this max.
@johnyangk Also, please post a link to here on the JIRA.

@bgchun @markusweimer I think I am done with the changes in response to your code review comments. Please have a look.

P.S. @shravanmn will open Jira issues regarding some outdated functionality that had been deleted from groupcomm. At least some parts of it must be re-implemented later with the new API - e.g. matrix multiplication example, scatter/gather functionality and some unit tests.

This pull request made compile error with 
[ERROR] COMPILATION ERROR : 
[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] /F:/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/Reef-pull-request-windows/lang/java/reef-io/src/main/java/org/apache/reef/io/network/naming/NameServer.java:[32,2] cannot find symbol
  symbol: class DefaultImplementation

 I don't have any idea why it could not find 'DefaultImplementation', which is defined in Tang. Also, this commit is successfully built in my local Mac OS X 10.9.5 machine. 

 Is there any way to rebuild this commit? Does anyone know what happened?
@gwsshs22 I triggered a rebuild. Let's see what happens.
I did not know another pull requests were merged... I will push merged commit soon.
